{"step_by_step_thinking": "The transvaginal ultrasound shows an intrauterine heteroechoic mass with numerous anechoic spaces and no identifiable fetus or amniotic fluid. This suggests the presence of a molar pregnancy. Additionally, both ovaries are enlarged and have multiple thin-walled, septated cysts with clear content. This is consistent with theca lutein cysts, which are associated with molar pregnancies. Therefore, the most likely cause of the ovarian findings is D. Theca lutein cysts.", "answer_choice": "D"}
